result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
9:42 AM Defendant Jesse M Klim Jr in court, in custody.  Attorney Tyler A Jochman in court for Jesse M Klim Jr. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Jack Rieder. 
Cases called to address the motion to modify bond in 22CF1235.

Atty Jochman makes arguments on the record.
State objects to any modification to bond.
Court declines the motion to modify bond. 

Defense has received discovery and requests time to review. 
Court adjourns hearing set for later this month.
Hearing scheduled for September 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.

09:36 AM Defendant Jesse M Klim in court, in custody, with attorney Tyler A Jochman.   Christian Farina appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Tracking 22CF1235.  Hearing scheduled for August 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.
State Public Defender - Order Appointing Counsel - Atty Tyler Jochman

01:24 PM Defendant Jesse M Klim in court, in custody, with attorney Ricardo Tapia.   Lesli S Boese appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Tracking 22CF1235.  Hearing scheduled for August 8, 2022 at 09:15 am.
To Seal Victim/Witness Identification Key signed by Judge Jennifer R. Dorow on 07/28/2022.

ADDRESS INFO for Jesse M Klim Jr
Current: 515 W Moreland Blvd, c/o Waukesha County Jail, Waukesha, WI 53188 United States  (Effective: 07-28-2022)
Prior: 4719 Vista Park Court Unit 4, Nashotah, WI 53058 United States

Defendant to have no contact with Victim A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.

02:14 PM Defendant Jesse M Klim in court, in custody.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Julian Marrufo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant was not evaluated by the public defender's office.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  Clerk of Court to notify Public Defender's Office to evaluate defendant tomorrow morning.  The Court will set this matter back for tomorrow with the hope the defendant has been evaluated by then.  Hearing scheduled for July 29, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
